Key Match Events: Jalen Brunson led all scorers with 10 points in the final frame, helping convert a close game to a comfortable win.
Post-Match Reflections: Despite Brunson's rough shooting, he's at 47% from the field and averaging about three assists for every turnover.
Karl-Anthony Towns has shown improved passing, with an over-the-back-of-his-head dime and precise passes from under the basket.
OG Anunoby had seven dunks, nearly triple as many as the next-highest player for either team contested, showing the impact of Towns in the lineup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brunson's shot chart from the win in Philadelphia is not Springfield-bound.
The Knicks were again bested from beyond the arc (+15 for Philly), but held a 57% mark and +36 advantage between the paint and the 3-point line.
The Sixers were rumored to be interested in Anunoby in free agency, highlighting his value.
Others: The Three Sixers in the picture above form a triptych, a visual trio. At its center is Embiid, resembling Pontius Pilate washing his hands of whatever comes of Brunsonâ€™s Hail Mary.
The Sixers' approach to the season continues to prioritize Embiid's health over winning, with Embiid stating he wants to play tonight despite the team's inconsistent messaging.
